03d21871-66ed-4505-bc2b-c6c1cf4dc333.description: PostgreSQL is one of the few open-source databases that is popular in corporate environments, but most developers only use its basic features. Earners of this badge have been taught to improve performance, reduce application complexity, and avoid common pitfalls by leveraging powerful PostgreSQL-specific features. Topics include: advanced DB administration, database programming (functions & stored procedures), PL/pgSQL, Triggers, Cursors, and querying JSON data inside a regular RDBMS table.
03d21871-66ed-4505-bc2b-c6c1cf4dc333.name: SQL-102: PostgreSQL Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 3.5-day PostgreSQL Fundamentals course (live instruction).
Pass a series of brief multiple choice assessments to check working knowledge. Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

fa875929-4b3b-458b-8046-eab81ea175b9.description: Earners of this badge gain pragmatic working knowledge of the Agile Engineering (XP) practices that complement Scrum and DevOps delivery methodologies, including Test-Driven Development and Refactoring. The material connects OOP design principles with key professional engineering outcomes: maintainability, testability and reuse. Earners must demonstrate competence in critical Java best practices affecting performance and correctness, via numerous hands-on exercises, and code review.
fa875929-4b3b-458b-8046-eab81ea175b9.name: JAVA-201: Professional Java

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 5-day Professional Java course (live instruction).
Successfully complete a progression of coding challenges.

In a small team, develop a working code solution for a set of business requirements, using the practices taught during the course. Adapt the solution mid-flight based on unexpected changes to the business requirements.
Present the team's solution to the class, for review and critique by the instructor, on the basis of Object-Oriented Design principles and Java Best Practices.
Overall grade must be 60% or higher to badge.

cfbd98ad-129d-4ca1-9ba2-7ceb7d5494a6.description: Earners of this badge have gained working knowledge of enterprise-level Java architectural patterns and practices, through the lens of Domain-Driven Design. Key topics include integration testing, performance and data consistency in high-concurrency systems, architecting for multiple teams, CQRS, database optimisation, and safe schema migration with Liquibase. Load testing with JMeter, and UI testing with Selenium are covered, as well as Java TestContainers, MockMvc and Mockito.
cfbd98ad-129d-4ca1-9ba2-7ceb7d5494a6.name: JAVA-301: Enterprise Java

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 5-day Enterprise Java course (live instruction).
Pass a series of brief multiple choice assessments to check working knowledge.
Complete a group-based machine problem, which is manually assessed by the course instructor.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

341e7793-383f-4cbd-aae7-4a0681abaabb.description: Earners of this badge understand the major features of Spring Framework, Spring Boot, and JPA with Hibernate (ORM). This includes configuration using annotations, Aspect-Oriented Programming, Spring Boot enhancements to testing with JUnit 5, Spring with relational databases (JDBC, JPA, Spring Data, Spring transaction support), Spring Boot auto-configuration and starters, Spring MVC and RestTemplate, and Spring Security. Coding assessment focuses on loosely-coupled, testable applications.
341e7793-383f-4cbd-aae7-4a0681abaabb.name: JAVA-202: Professional Spring Boot with JPA

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 5-day Professional Spring Boot with JPA course.
Pass a series of brief multiple choice assessments to check working knowledge.
Complete a series of coding challenges to demonstrate understanding of key concepts.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

013364bc-7734-456c-a194-71bfa421b1e0.description: Earners of this badge have a working knowledge of Java 11 and the most commonly used libraries of the Java Standard Edition (Java SE). They were taken through a learning-by-doing approach, and hence, can now develop Java applications using modern IDEs, write well-structured code using Object Oriented Principles (OOP), use JDBC to perform SQL database queries, use proper exception-handling techniques, and write thread-safe parallel processing code, and avoid common concurrency pitfalls.
013364bc-7734-456c-a194-71bfa421b1e0.name: JAVA-101: Java Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 7-day Java Fundamentals course (live instruction).
Pass a series of brief multiple choice assessments to check working knowledge.
Complete a group-based machine problem, which is manually assessed by the course instructor.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

6eb301eb-4e90-4e1a-a32c-53112d4e1081.description: Earners of this badge have a solid understanding of how business requirements become database designs, and the basics of reading and writing to a relational database using SQL (Structured Query Language). This course is not just for developers, but for anyone who wants to understand the impact of business requirements to complexity and cost, and wants a high-level appreciation of managing data stored in relational databases, including business analysts, QA, testers, and project managers.
6eb301eb-4e90-4e1a-a32c-53112d4e1081.name: SQL-101: SQL Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 2-day SQL Fundamentals course (live instruction).
Pass a series of brief multiple choice assessments to check working knowledge. Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

874fdb60-98a5-41d3-8662-94d2b7793641.description: Earners of this badge have a fundamental understanding of HTML programming and building web pages using this technology. Through extensive hands-on exercises, badge-earners gained a workable foundation in HTML and CSS and introductory knowledge of JavaScript and Bootstrap, which will enable them to move on to more advanced courses. This training course was developed and is taught by some of the Philippines’ best-known developers, and uses a format trusted by the best companies in the country.
874fdb60-98a5-41d3-8662-94d2b7793641.name: WEB-101: Web Development Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 2-day Web Fundamentals course (live instruction).
Pass a series of brief multiple choice assessments to check working knowledge. Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

d13a6ff5-36f5-4e77-8e28-5aa7a2709d48.description: Earners of this badge have a working knowledge of the methodologies and practices available in Agile, and to which situation each applies. They’ve also gained a shared perspective when addressing process improvements. Other learnings include how Agile values affect requirements engineering; identifying and describing user roles; writing and evaluating user stories; estimation and prioritization for iterations and releases; and writing effective acceptance criteria and tests for user stories.
d13a6ff5-36f5-4e77-8e28-5aa7a2709d48.name: AGILE-101: Agile Fundamentals (Maya Cadetship Program)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 3-day Agile Fundamentals course under the Maya Cadetship Program.
Pass a series of brief assessments to check working knowledge.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

f1b7b096-c431-4815-8802-da945aea268b.description: Earners of this badge know how to build front end applications with React JS that are extensible, maintainable, and readily testable. Through this course, they created a full front-end application using React JS, integrated with a fully functioning REST API. Having learned key concepts in core JavaScript, they also learned how to structure user interface elements according to the Atomic Design System. They also know how to use SaSS to generate parameterized, namespaced CSS stylesheets.
f1b7b096-c431-4815-8802-da945aea268b.name: Core JavaScript and React Web (Maya Cadetship Program)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 5-day Core JavaScript and React Web course under the Maya Cadetship Program.
Pass a series of tasks and assessments to check working knowledge.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

b4baece7-f504-4410-bf65-1b2d7bf06016.description: Earners of this badge have learned about the concept, features, use cases, and benefits of containers, and the difference between containers and virtual machines. They have a working knowledge of Docker, some of its more commonly used command line interface (CLI) commands, and how they work. Badge earners can build container images using Dockerfiles, and they also learned about container registries and the functionalities they provide to help developers work more securely and productively.
b4baece7-f504-4410-bf65-1b2d7bf06016.name: DEVOPS-101: Docker and Kubernetes Fundamentals (Maya Cadetship Program)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 3-day Docker and Kubernetes Fundamentals course under the Maya Cadetship Program.
Pass a series of tasks and assessments to check working knowledge.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

29a891a2-5d45-4a8e-b155-87299f60ce2c.description: Earners of this badge have a working knowledge of Linux and will be able to do basic command line operations on a Linux or Unix bash shell. Badge earners know how to take advantage of the flexibility that comes with Linux, while simultaneously benefitting from its robust security against viruses, crashes, and malware. They have learned general utility commands, files and directories, file attributes and networking, bash scripting, Vim and GEdit, basic networking, and managing processes.
29a891a2-5d45-4a8e-b155-87299f60ce2c.name: DEVOPS-102: Linux Fundamentals (Maya Cadetship Program)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 1-Day Linux Fundamentals course under the Maya Cadetship Program.
Pass a series of tasks and assessments to check working knowledge.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

9b3d3c8b-3e80-45c5-b01e-94c8267c5928.description: Earners of this badge have a clear understanding of how workflows in distributed version control differ from those in centralized version control, and knowledge on best practices specific to Git. They also know how maximize the use of Git, having learned its powerful features such as finding bugs or resolving conflict. They learned about checking status, staging, and reviewing commits, unstaging files, branching, merging, tagging, sharing a remote repository with GitLab or GitHub, and more.
9b3d3c8b-3e80-45c5-b01e-94c8267c5928.name: DEVOPS-103: Git Fundamentals (Maya Cadetship Program)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 1-day Git Fundamentals course under the Maya Cadetship Program.
Pass a series of tasks and assessments to check working knowledge.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

db4bbcdf-74cf-49ff-b51f-cae2465df1e8.description: Earners of this badge know how to build solutions using the different Amazon Web Services (AWS) discussed during the training. Topics covered by the course include: Introduction to AWS, Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Elastic Load Balancer, Simple Storage Service (S3), Relational Database Service (RDS), API Gateway, Cognito, Virtual Private Cloud (VPC), AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), Cloudwatch, DynamoDB, and AWS Lambda.
db4bbcdf-74cf-49ff-b51f-cae2465df1e8.name: DEVOPS-205: AWS Cloud Practitioner Preparation (Maya Cadetship Program)

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 5-day AWS Cloud Practitioner Preparation under the Maya Cadetship Program.
Pass a series of tasks and assessments to check working knowledge.
Final grade must be 60% or above to Badge.

6d5c0f6a-696e-4f0a-8f72-0508018702e5.description: Earners of this badge have a working knowledge of Java 11 and the most commonly used libraries of the Java Standard Edition (Java SE).
